meanings.definition: To regard or treat as having little or no value.
meanings.sent1: She kept disvaluing her own achievements, never recognizing their true worth.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students against disvaluing the efforts of their classmates.
meanings.sent3: By disvaluing the handmade gift, he unintentionally hurt his friend's feelings.
meanings.sent4: Her constant disvaluing of his opinions chipped away at his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The act of disvaluing can have long-lasting effects on one's self-confidence.

meanings.definition: To diminish the worth or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: The negative comments online were disvaluing the reputation of the small business.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions ended up disvaluing the antique vase he inherited.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick of disvaluing the precious gem left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism was like a hammer disvaluing the delicate glass sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The politician's scandal was disvaluing the trust of the voters.
